definition: to walk right into the trap

sentences.english: The insect found itself entangled in an inextricable net.
sentences.chinese: 昆蟲發現自己被纏在一個逃脫不掉的羅網中。

sentences.english: An old fox is not easily snared.
The fear of man is a trap.
All previous "devil" can beat step, escape the net of police bs.
sentences.chinese: 歷次“魔鬼”都能搶先一步，逃離警方佈下的羅網。

sentences.english: He that gathereth treasures by a lying tongue, is vain and foolish, and shall stumble upon the snares of death.
sentences.chinese: 以謊言僞語騙得的財寶，是浮雲輕煙，死亡的羅網。

sentences.english: She entrapped herself in the web of her own lies.
sentences.chinese: 她陷入了自己編造的謊話羅網。

sentences.english: Obstinate are the trammels, but my heart aches when I try to break them.
sentences.chinese: 羅網是堅韌的，若要撕裂它們，我又會心痛。

sentences.english: Or maybe longer than that if you can keep your web wound tight around him.
sentences.chinese: 甚至還不止，只要你的羅網把小主公套得更牢一點。

sentences.english: Obstinate are the trammels, but my heart aches when I try to break them.
sentences.chinese: 羅網是堅韌的，但是要撕破它的時候我又要心痛。

sentences.english: You can catch these insects by tempting them to fly into a trap.
sentences.chinese: 你可以引誘這些昆蟲飛進羅網從而捉住它們。

sentences.english: He himself fell into snares spread for her.
sentences.chinese: 他自己陷入了原爲她撒開的羅網。

sentences.english: To see the universe as it is, you must step beyond the net.
sentences.chinese: 要得見真如，你必須踏出這個羅網。

sentences.english: He became gradually enmeshed in the web of Her all-pervading presence.
sentences.chinese: 他逐漸地陷入她遍及所有的羅網中。

sentences.english: A very few do jump out of the net, making a big splash in the water.
sentences.chinese: 非常少數的會跳出羅網，發出很大的濺潑聲。

sentences.english: The hunters used nets to entrap the lion.
sentences.chinese: 獵人們以羅網誘捕獅子。

sentences.english: The fear of the Lord is a fountain of life, to decline from the ruin of death.
sentences.chinese: 敬畏上主，是生命的泉源，使人脫免死亡的羅網。

definition: Vertical Alliance, clique of the School of Diplomacy 縱橫家|纵横家[Zong4 heng2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (425-221 BC)
many men, a great force (idiom); many hands provide great strength/There is safety in numbers.
to spin a web (spider)/to weave a net (e.g. for fishing)
lit. wind sighing and crane calling (idiom)/fig. to panic at the slightest move/to be jittery
lit. to use a dog's tail as a substitute for sable fur (idiom)/fig. a worthless sequel to a masterpiece
to threaten the east and strike to the west (idiom)/to create a diversion
the State of Qǐ in modern Qǐ county 杞縣|杞县, Henan (c. 1500-445 BC), a small vassal state of Shang and Western Zhou for most of its existence
Liuying township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
